On 2/24/06, jason r tibbetts <tibbettj@...> wrote:
> Mark Le=
vison wrote:
*snip*

> I like to take the catch block one step further and =
call
> assertTrue(true) (as has been discussed on this list), or, better ye=
t,
> call something like pass(), which I've defined in a base TestCase to d=
o
> just that. It makes a nice juxtaposition with the fail(), and it keeps
=
> style checkers from bitching about empty catch clauses.

I've also taken =
to coding up a pass() method and I use that in the
formerly empty catch blo=
ck. I think it makes a good complement to the
fail() method as well.

priva=
te void pass() {}

That works for me. I slip it at the bottom of the test f=
ile. We don't
have a formal wrapper for TestCase around here, so that's the=
 best I
can do.
